channel.title: System Update
channel.description: How can I do that timer where it says "System Update in 1:00" and counts down?

item.title: System Update
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

people, its in every server source!

just type

::update 100

that will make it “System update in: 1:20”
and count down intill 0 and then will shut down the server.

Read full topic

item.title: System Update
item.dc:creator: @_Mod_Dude |Mod Dude|
item.description:
@_Mod_Dude wrote:

[quote="|Mod Dude|, post:3, topic:118982"]Add this with your other commands:

if (command.startsWith("update") && command.length() > 7 && playerRights >= 3) {
            PlayerHandler.updateSeconds = (Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7))+1);
            PlayerHandler.updateAnnounced = false;
            PlayerHandler.updateRunning = true;
            PlayerHandler.updateStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis();
}

There you have it. ;)[/quote]

put it after

	else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("fish"))
     {
     if(absY >= 3672 && absY <= 3970) 
     {
     sendMessage("You cannot teleport above level 20 wilderness..");
     }
     else if (absY <= 3672)
	{
		teleportToX = 3240;
		teleportToY = 3435;
		sendMessage("Use the fountain your closet to you rite now to fish.");
		sendMessage("Make sure what your fishing with is in slot 1 of your items.");
		sendMessage("Type in ::fishingmenu for more info.");
	}

or any other command after the }

Read full topic

item.title: System Update
item.dc:creator: @_Mod_Dude |Mod Dude|
item.description:
@_Mod_Dude wrote:

Add this with your other commands:

if (command.startsWith("update") && command.length() > 7 && playerRights >= 3) {
            PlayerHandler.updateSeconds = (Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7))+1);
            PlayerHandler.updateAnnounced = false;
            PlayerHandler.updateRunning = true;
            PlayerHandler.updateStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis();
}

There you have it.

Read full topic
